model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Hey, I just wanted to share some exciting news with you. I was promoted to product manager!
Really? Congrats! That's a big step up from your previous role.
Yeah, I'm feeling a mix of excitement and nervousness. It's a lot of responsibility, but I'm ready for the challenge.
I have no doubt that you'll do great. You've always been a strong leader and have a great eye for detail.
Thanks, that means a lot. I'm looking forward to working with the design team and coming up with some innovative new products.
Speaking of new products, remember when you used to fantasize about being a great leader?
Ha, yeah. That seems like ages ago.
Well, now you can finally take on that leadership role and make your dreams a reality.
That's true. It's amazing how life works out sometimes. But it hasn't always been smooth sailing. Remember when I was really stressed about you not liking me?
Yeah, I remember. But we worked through it, didn't we?
We definitely did. And it taught me to just take things one step at a time, like I am with this new role.
Exactly, and I'm sure you'll apply that same mentality to your training as well. I remember you were really dedicated to it a couple of years ago.
Oh yeah, I still try to keep up with it whenever I can. It's important to stay physically and mentally fit, especially with this new job.
Just don't let your anger get the better of you again. Remember when you exploded and started throwing things?
Ugh, let's not even go there. My parents gave me a good scolding for that.
Well, all that matters is that you learn from your mistakes and keep moving forward. And hey, you're doing just that with this promotion.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Progress and personal growth', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A reflects on personal growth and progress with support from Co-workers B.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Definitely. And now, I feel like I've grown so much and I've become more confident in myself. ### Co-workers B: That's great to hear. It's amazing how much progress we can make when we just take things one step at a time. ### Co-workers A: Yes, exactly. I also remember when I used to fantasize about being a great leader. I wanted to be respected and admired by others. ### Co-workers B: I can relate to that. It's a natural desire to want to be viewed in a positive light by others. ### Co-workers A: And now, I feel like I'm on the right path to achieving that goal. I work hard every day to improve and I hope that it shows. ### Co-workers B: You definitely have my respect and admiration. You've come a long way and I'm proud of you. ### Co-workers A: Thanks, that means a lot. It's great to feel like I have your support.' }
```
